title: 10X-CITEseq protocol (COVID-19 patient samples +/- tetramer stain)

source.description:
Take two TotalSeq-C Human Panel vials from
fridge.

source.body: Briefly centrifuge each tube before opening.

source.description:

.

-
or until the solution visually looks resuspended.

Centrifuge at
.

Combine antibody pool from two vials and keep at
until ready for staining.

Turn water bath on to
, pre-warm
.
While cRPMI warms:
Get a bucket with dry ice and a large container with regular ice.

Label 24 of each of the following tube/vials:
a. 15 mL falcon tubes
b. Vicell sample tubes
Bring all the vials from LN2 tank and keep on dry ice until needed.

Aliquot
into each 15mL tube.

Thaw four vials at a time in
water bath for
until only a small ice crystal remains and immediately hand over to partner to unscrew the vial aseptically.

Aliquot
-
(5-6x105 cells) of thawed cells to its respective 15mL falcon tube drop by drop and mix gently twice with a P1000 pipette.

Centrifuge at
.

source.body: During this centrifugation step, add 570µL of dPBS to each ViCell sample tube in preparation.

source.description:
Cap the cryovial and transfer to a Mr. Frosty and move to -80°C freezer for
before moving to LN2.

Add
to each ViCell sample tube if not performed previously (step 12).

Aspirate supernatant and resuspend in
, keep cells
from this step.

Count cells on Vicell (
diluted in
).
Record total cell count and viability, using template below:
i. If the total cell count is above 1x106, the remainder of the cells can be saved for bulk RNA-seq
ii. In ViCell counting, use cell-type PBMC and dilution factor 1:20

Calculate volume needed to collect total 1.5 x 106 cells from all samples using the template below:
i. Calculate volume of each sample needed to get equal number of cells from each sample
ii. For samples that don’t have enough cells, thaw more cells from the same vial in -80°C freezer
iii. Make note of cell viability and also include dead cells in the total cell count. Do not use samples that have low cell viability (< 85%), or enrich live cell with dead cell removal kit
Take remaining cells from each sample after multiplexing.

Spin at
.
Aspirate supernatant.
Either freeze the pellets in the -80°C or proceed to RNA extraction.
Perform RNA Extraction as according to manufacturer’s protocol: Extract RNA with Qiagen RNeasy Plus Mini Kit (elute in 30µL) and quantify RNA with Qubit (Use 1µL for Qubit concentration).
Use SmartSeq-2 protocol for bulk RNA library preparation.
Use cell counts from ViCell to pool each sample into 5mL round bottom polystyrene tubes to get 1.5 x 106 cells in total.

Centrifuge at
.
Aspirate supernatant, taking care not to disturb the cell pellet

source.body:
If using Flowmi strainer, be careful not to push the tip too hard as it is fragile.
Note that ~ 30% of the cell suspension is lost when using a flowmi strainer.
If final volume is very small (less than ), use conventional cell strainers

source.description:
Take
+
for counting with Countess and check for count and viability. (Vicell can be used here instead).

source.body:
a. The desired cell density is 2.5 x 106 cell/mL (or 2,500 cell/µ).
b. If cells are too dense, use staining buffer to dilute cells to final density.
c. Use 30.8 µL (or appropriate amount if concentration different) for each well of 10x library preparation to ensure 77,000 cells from each sample are added to the master mix.
d. Note in 10X VDJ protocol, only 90µL of 100µL cell suspension+master mix is loaded to each well, so the actual cells loaded are 2,500 cell/µL*28µL*(90/100) = 50,000.
e. Maximum volume of cell suspension can be loaded to 10x VDJ run is ,make up extra volume using staining buffer.

source.description: Load 70,000 cells/well into 6 wells of VDJ kits and perform GEM-RT.

Save GEM-RT at
for up to 3 days or
for up to 1 week before 10X library preparation

If final volume is very small (less than 50 μL) use conventional cell strainers

source.description:
Take
and
for counting with Countess

source.body:
• Vicell can be used here instead
  • The desired cell density is 2.5x106 cell/mL (or 2,500 cell/μL)
  • If cells are too dense, use staining buffer to dilute cells to final density
  • Use 30.8 μL (or appropriate amount if concentration is different) for each well of 10x library preparation to ensure 77,000 cells from each sample are added to the mastermix
  • Note in 10X V(D)J protocol, only 90 μL of the 100 μL cell suspension + mastermix is loaded to each well, so the actual cells loaded are 2,000 cell/μL x 30.8 μL x (90/100) = 70,000
  • Maximum volume of cell suspension can be loaded to 10X V(D)J run is 31.7 μL, make up extra volume using staining buffer

materials.name: Human TruStain FcX™ (Fc Receptor Blocking Solution)

description:
Purpose
To detail the workflow for scCITE-Seq of 24 PBMC samples with 2 technicians. This is based on internal 10X CITEseq protocol v9.
